text: [Music]
hi everyone Hy Dr Tano here the
internet's busiest music nerd and it's
time for a review of this new Ken Carson
album a great chaos this is the third
fulllength LP from rapper Ken Carson one
of the most influential artists in this
current wave of Rage music and also one
of the bigger names on Playboy card's
opium label at the moment now I first
reviewed the Man's music back in 2022
with his record X which generally I
thought was pretty unimpressive while
aesthetic it fit right into that rage
Lane with the crisp repetitive trap
beats bright syy instrumentals and some
harsh Distortion caked onto everything
on occasion there was still something
about it that felt way shti than
everything to come before it in the
genre from the vocal mixing to the
rapping to the compression being so
heavy on almost everything in the mix
that the vocals and beats were uh kind
of crackling at the end of the day it
all felt very hamfisted and clueless and
sloppy not to mention that Ken doesn't
have the most recognizable Style or
voice on top of it yeah sadly I really
struggled to say anything nice about
this LP and yeah I assumed people would
kind of hate my review but one thing
that kind of confused me about the
reaction of some fans was the
insinuation that Ken was on to something
new here something groundbreaking that
some people just weren't getting as if
his music isn't an obvious continuation
of the trippy trap production ISM we've
heard from Travis Scott and future and
already Playboy cardi the man whose
label he is on for years there are even
some quirky and elastic vocal
inflections on this new LP uh that sound
like young thug so getting what Ken
Carson is doing and where it's coming
from is not rocket science in fact
there's only a thin layer of surface
level differences separating it from a
lot of other trap out there today which
also includes the way it's marketed it's
dark it's alternative it's kind of rock
adjacent in a way it serves as a
reminder the style and pretentiousness
can go a long way when it comes to
repackaging something for an audience
and not that it's necessary that Ken
Carson be wholly original and totally
unlike any other artist out there but
don't blow smoke up my ass about how
what he's doing is somehow beyond
comprehension in fact it's painfully
basic and sometimes feels like a lesser
version of the much weirder darker and
more distorted trap that guys like
cemetery and haunted Mound have been
dropping for a while now it's also worth
mentioning the very dark and lowii
Memphis rap Vibes that guys like Space
Ghost per were on the scene with uh back
during his early mixtape days now with
all of that being said though this new
one from Ken does feel like a slight
Improvement the Beats generally sound
more interesting they are actually kind
of outlandish here and there like with
the spooky leads and speedily throbbing
synths on Singapore and honestly I'm not
sure what the hell is going on with me
in my cup all I know is it sounds insane
and while I'm not crazy about it it's a
pretty ballsy move to throw a synth onto
the song pots that sounds like a godamn
clown tricycle horn I'll also give it to
Ken that the flows on this LP sound more
coherent he doesn't just sound like he's
endlessly uh rambling while he still
does that on occasion like with a
Nightcore where he gives us a lyrical
introduction to himself that includes
the line uh these dude's constipated and
I know I'm the yeah I need me a
pamper but there are some tracks here
that did lead me to kind of bobbing my
head and vibing along be that green room
or Jennifer's Body or Rockstar lifestyle
and I will say Carson does make more
attent at choruses on this project too
which is admirable even if some of the
results are mixed like with the kind of
annoying hardcore and also a very
pitiful attempt at a love song with
nightcore to the way that she moved the
way that she mooved the way that she
moved the way Carson even goes
toe-to-toe with Lil Uzi on the song like
this keeping them from completely
dominating the track though I do think a
lot of that came down to Uzi not really
going into the song with a game plan now
even if there are positives and relative
high points on this LP there are still
some tracks that are so distorted the
Beats feel like hot piss being poured
right into my ear canal be that with
succubus or lose it and it's just
unnecessary having the songs be this
distorted adds nothing to the track it's
not harsh it's not scary it's not out
there it's not outlandish it's not
overwhelming it just feels like a
regular trap song with a light level of
white noise being placed over everything
but also by that same token the cleanest
sounding cuts on the lp like Paranoid
featuring destroy lonely they're so
average and non-descript sonically it's
almost like these opium guys need their
songs to sound like in order for it
to come across as an opium type song in
addition to that there are some tracks
on this thing that are so short they
might as well not even be here and dare
I say a moment or two that just didn't
go hard enough for example vampire hours
skittering high hats and uh kind of
fruity synthesizer Loops doesn't exactly
capture that vampire energy we have a
forgettable closer on this record too
and honestly by the end of this thing
Ken Carson has pretty much painted
himself into a corner and hasn't
provided much in the way of variation
across Ross all these tracks while like
I said I do think this record is an
improvement over his last yeah it's not
by much and look it's not because Ken
needs to reinvent the wheel or be wholly
different than anybody else out there
you know just some records that have
more substance over style would be nice
or better performances songwriting
that's actually catchy uh mixing that's
legitimately good you know maybe it
doesn't just sound like a Bas boosted
YouTube poop but I don't know maybe
that's too much to ask I'm feeling a
decent three on this one transition have
you given this album a listen did you
love it did you hate it what would you
rate it you're the best you're the best
what should I review next hit the like
if you like Please Subscribe and please
don't cry hit the Bell as well over here
next to my head is another video you can
check out hit that up or the link to
subscribe to the channel Anthony fantano
Ken Carson forever
